recipe_name: Healthy Banana Chocolate Chip Oat Muffins
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups whole wheat flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup rolled oats"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup semi-sweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup unsweetened applesauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup skim milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup mashed banana"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper liners."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir whole wheat flour, rolled oats, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and chocolate chips together in a bowl. Make a well in the center."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk eggs in a separate bowl until frothy; mix applesauce, skim milk, and banana into eggs. Pour wet ingredients into well made in flour mixture; stir just to moisten. Batter will be lumpy. Fill the prepared muffin cups about 3/4 full."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of several muffins comes out clean, 16 to 18 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing to finish cooling on wire racks."}]

Drizzle olive oil over the carrot strips and toss to coat. Season with salt; toss again. Spread carrots onto 2 baking sheets in a single layer, preventing overlap."},{"recipe_directions":"Put one baking sheet on the top rack and the other on the bottom. Bake carrots in preheated oven for 6 minutes, switch racks, and continue baking until the carrots are crisp, about 6 minutes more. Cool chips until cool enough to handle before serving."}]

recipe_card: Great Chicken Taquitos 31 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ½ cups vegetable oil (such as Crisco®), divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup finely chopped tomatoes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup minced green onions"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon dried oregano"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon chili powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 (6 inch) corn tortillas"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12  wooden picks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup shredded lettuce, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup guacamole, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Bring water to a simmer in a skillet over medium heat; add chicken. Cover the skillet and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 20 to 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove chicken from water and cool; shred with a fork. Discard water and dry the skillet with a paper towel."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the skillet over medium heat; cook and stir shredded chicken, tomatoes, green onions, chicken broth, flour, garlic, cumin, oregano, chili powder, and salt until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat remaining vegetable oil in a heavy 10-inch skillet over medium heat; carefully dip tortillas in hot oil to soften, about 1 minute. Remove tortillas with tongs and drain on paper towels, reserving oil in the skillet."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat reserved oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon about 2 tablespoons chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla. Tightly roll each tortilla around the filling and secure with a wooden toothpick."},{"recipe_directions":"Working in batches, fry rolled tortillas in hot oil until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove taquitos with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve taquitos on a bed of shredded lettuce with guacamole on the side."}]

Dry according to the manufacturer's instructions until pieces are candied, 6 to 8 hours."}]

recipe_card: Crazy Bread 52 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons active dry yeast"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pinches white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup warm water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 cups all-purpose flour, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups hot water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets."},{"recipe_directions":"Dissolve yeast and 2 pinches white sugar in warm water in a bowl. Let stand until the yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix 4 cups flour, hot water, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt together in a large mixing bowl; pour yeast mixture into the flour mixture and mix. Add remaining flour, one cup at a time, mixing well between additions. Continue to work the mixture until you have a dough; divide dough into 2 halves. Divide each half into 12 long breadsticks and arrange onto prepared baking sheets."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour melted butter and sprinkle Parmesan cheese and garlic powder over the breadsticks."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 13 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Sweet Potato Hummus 36 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Appetizers and Snacks"},{"recipe_tags":"Dips and Spreads Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Hummus Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3  sweet potatoes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained (reserve liquid) and rinsed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons tahini"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon lemon zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground cumin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground coriander"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground white pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"sea salt to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Poke holes all over sweet potatoes with a fork."},{"recipe_directions":"Roast sweet potatoes in the preheated oven until soft, about 45 minutes; let cool. Cut sweet potatoes in half lengthwise."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine garbanzo beans and olive oil in a blender and pulse several times to mash. Scoop flesh out of sweet potato peels and add to the blender; pulse to combine. Add tahini, lemon juice, lemon zest, cumin, coriander, white pepper, and sea salt to mixture; blend until smooth, adding reserved garbanzo bean liquid as needed to make a smooth, creamy hummus."}]

recipe_card: Chef John's Baba Ghanoush 58 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large Italian eggplants"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves crushed garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lemon, juiced, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons tahini, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons plain Greek yogurt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 leaf fresh mint, minced (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Prick the surface of the skin of eggplants several times with the tip of a knife."},{"recipe_directions":"Place eggplants directly on grill. Turn frequently with tongs while skin chars. Cook until eggplants have collapsed and are very soft, 25 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cover tightly with aluminum foil and allow to cool, about 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"When eggplants are cool enough to handle, split them in half and scrape flesh into a colander placed over a bowl. Drain 5 or 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer eggplant to mixing bowl. Add crushed garlic and salt; mash until creamy but with a little texture, about 5 minutes. Whisk in lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, and cayenne pepper. Stir in yogurt."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely chilled, 3 or 4 hours. Taste to adjust seasonings. Stir in mint and parsley."}]

recipe_card: Toe's Best Salsa 19 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Dips and Spreads Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Salsa Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Tomato Salsa Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1  white onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (15 ounce) cans tomato sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  jalapeno peppers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  serrano pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cloves garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lime, juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ bunch cilantro"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place the onion in a bowl, and set aside. In a blender, place tomato sauce, jalapeno peppers, serrano pepper, garlic, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Blend well. Place the cilantro into the blender, and pulse several times to chop the cilantro. Do not over blend. Pour the tomato sauce mixture into the bowl with the onion, stir well to combine, and refrigerate at least 1 hour to blend flavors before serving."}]

recipe_card: Chef John's Chocolate Energy Bars 56 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place cashews, almonds, coconut, dates, cocoa, coconut oil, vanilla, cold coffee, cayenne and salt in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse on and off to start. Process about 1 minute; check to ensure mixture is sticky and moist enough to stick together. Add more coffee if needed. Continue to process until mixture becomes a chunky mass."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a baking pan with plastic wrap. Scoop mixture into pan. Press down with a spatula until mixture is even. Place a layer of plastic wrap on the surface and smooth again with your hands."},{"recipe_directions":"Refrigerate until cold and firm, 2 or 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove from the pan and unwrap. Cut into bars of your preferred size. Store in a zip top back in the refrigerator."}]

recipe_card: Watermelon Fruit Bowl 31 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"With a large, sharp knife, remove the top 1/4 section of the watermelon. With a melon baller, scoop flesh from inside of watermelon, removing as many seeds as possible. Leave 1/2 inch of flesh inside the shell of the watermelon. Scoop cantaloupe and honeydew in the same manner, removing as much flesh as possible, and discarding the rinds. Refrigerate fruits separately until ready to assemble."},{"recipe_directions":"In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring water and sugar to a boil. Remove from heat, and continue stirring until sugar has completely dissolved. Add lemon zest, and set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"To serve, place watermelon balls, cantaloupe, honeydew, oranges, pineapple, strawberries, and grapes, in a large mixing bowl. Pour syrup over, and toss thoroughly. Transfer mixture to watermelon bowl, and serve. Set aside any fruit mixture that will not fit. There will be enough fruit to refill the bowl."}]

Remove with a slotted spoon, and drain on paper towels."}]

recipe_card: Kale Chips 294 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch kale"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sherry vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch sea salt, to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut away inner ribs from each kale leaf and discard; tear leaves into pieces of uniform size, about the size of a small potato chip. Wash torn kale pieces and spin dry in a salad spinner or dry with paper towels until very dry."},{"recipe_directions":"Place kale pieces into a large resealable bag. Add about 1/2 of the olive oil; squeeze out air and seal, then massage the bag so oil gets distributed evenly on kale pieces. Add remaining oil and massage the bag more, until all kale pieces are evenly coated with oil. Sprinkle vinegar over the kale leaves, reseal the bag and shake well. Spread the leaves evenly onto a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until mostly crisp, about 35 minutes. Season with salt and serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Healthier Banana Banana Bread 140 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ cup nonfat plain yogurt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  eggs, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ⅓ cups mashed overripe bananas"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Beat butter, yogurt, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color. Add room-temperature eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into butter mixture before adding the next. Stir in mashed bananas until well blended. Pour banana mixture to flour mixture; stir just to moisten. Transfer batter into prepared loaf pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean, 60 to 65 minutes. Let bread cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto wire rack to cool completely."}]

recipe_card: Smoky Four-Pepper Salsa 17 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Dips and Spreads Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Salsa Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Tomato Salsa Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"8  ripe plum tomatoes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  poblano peppers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  Anaheim chile peppers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  jalapeno chile pepper, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large green bell pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼  onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon mesquite flavored liquid smoke concentrate (Optional)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Rub tomatoes with oil and grill for 10 minutes, turn. Place poblano, Anaheim, jalapeno chiles, and the green pepper on the grill. Grill 5 to 7 minutes per side, being careful not to let them burn. The skins should blister and brown. Remove tomatoes to a separate bowl. Place the chiles and pepper in an airtight container to let them steam while they cool so they're easier to peel."},{"recipe_directions":"Peel tomatoes and drain excess liquid. Peel and seed peppers."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the tomatoes, chiles, green pepper, cilantro, vinegar, onion, garlic, and salt in the container of a food processor. Pulse 4 or 5 times. Add liquid smoke and more jalapenos if desired. Pulse until salsa is as chunky or smooth as you like."}]

Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight."}]

Working with one round at a time while all others are covered with a damp cloth, flatten with the palm of your hand, then use a rolling pin to roll into 6- to 8-inch diameter circle."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat a dry skillet or tava over medium-high heat. recipe_card: Honey Wheat Bread II 390 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Yeast Bread Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Whole Grain Bread Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Wheat Bread"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups whole wheat flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon active dry yeast"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 cups all-purpose flour"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Dissolve yeast in warm water. Add honey, and stir well. Mix in whole wheat flour, salt, and vegetable oil. Work all-purpose flour in gradually. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead for at least 10 to 15 minutes. When dough is smooth and elastic, place it in a well oiled bowl. Turn it several times in the bowl to coat the surface of the dough, and cover with a damp cloth. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Punch down the dough. Shape into two loaves, and place into two well greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans. Allow to rise until dough is 1 to 1 1/2 inches above pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 25 to 30 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Salt and Pepper Skillet Fries 46 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large potatoes, sliced lengthwise into 1/2-inch circles and cut into 1/2-inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon coarse sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon cracked black pepper"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook and stir potato strips in hot oil mixture until browned on all sides, 20 to 25 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer fries to a paper towel-lined plate; season with sea salt and cracked black pepper."}]

recipe_card: Texas Caviar 345 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Appetizers and Snacks"},{"recipe_tags":"Dips and Spreads Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Bean Dip Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pint cherry tomatoes, quartered"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can black-eyed peas, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) bottle zesty Italian dressing"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  jalapeno peppers, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground coriander"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Mix together tomatoes, black-eyed peas, black beans, Italian dressing, bell pepper, onion, green onions, jalapeño peppers, garlic, and coriander in a large bowl. Cover and chill salad in the refrigerator for about 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Toss salad with desired amount of cilantro to serve."}]
